column4: hi, how do I get swedish chars to work in terminal outside X?
you have the language support installed for swedish language?
I don't know, how do I check? I don't use gnome or kde btw.
what do you use for a package manager?
synaptic
could you please go into synaptic and search for swedish
I'm working on it.
nope
then you need to install it--for system wide, open office or whatever you need
I want all programs to keep talking english while supporting swedish characters to be typed.
should I install language-pack-sv and language-pack-sv-base?
sounds like a plan ;]
and then just reboot and it works?
well then you need to go into system preferences keyboard and add swedish as a layout to your kb
I have set that to swedish and still I don't get swedish chars outside X.
in the keyboard layout you have to define the trigger key that will switch between the layouts
no
you have not enabled the switch or cannot find it or what--not sure what your 'no' means here
I only have one layout that is swedish, how could I possibly switch layouts?
I don't have swedish working, I want swedish =)
I want swedish to work outside X, you know the terminal you get to when pressing ctrl+alt+F1
then go into keyboard, enable the swedish layout, install the swedish language support and define a trigger in the same place that you set the keyboard layout
yep
